resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
lidavidm commented on PR #14103:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14103#issuecomment-1245451298

   Great, thank you. I'll try to review this soon.
   
   (Note that we generally use a single jira per PR, you can create jira sub-tasks for each PR if you like or just separate jiras)

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #14103:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14103#issuecomment-1245572137

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

andreoss commented on code in PR #14103:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14103#discussion_r972013913


##########
java/pom.xml:
##########
@@ -398,7 +398,14 @@
         </plugin>
         <plugin>
           <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
-          <version>3.0.0-M7</version>
+          <version>2.22.2</version>

Review Comment:
   @lidavidm 
   I believe it's related to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SUREFIRE-2033

andreoss commented on code in PR #14103:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14103#discussion_r972013913


##########
java/pom.xml:
##########
@@ -398,7 +398,14 @@
         </plugin>
         <plugin>
           <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
-          <version>3.0.0-M7</version>
+          <version>2.22.2</version>

Review Comment:
   @lidavidm 
   I believe it's the same problem as reported here https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SUREFIRE-2033

lidavidm commented on code in PR #14103:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14103#discussion_r972138198


##########
java/pom.xml:
##########
@@ -398,7 +398,14 @@
         </plugin>
         <plugin>
           <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
-          <version>3.0.0-M7</version>
+          <version>2.22.2</version>

Review Comment:
   Hmm. Is it possible to downgrade to only, say, 3.0.0-M4, and add a comment linking to the regression? Or otherwise, is it possible to configure the runners to avoid this?

andreoss commented on code in PR #14103:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14103#discussion_r972240630


##########
java/pom.xml:
##########
@@ -398,7 +398,14 @@
         </plugin>
         <plugin>
           <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
-          <version>3.0.0-M7</version>
+          <version>2.22.2</version>

Review Comment:
   @lidavidm Done. Fixed by adding extra decencies to surefire, the version remains '3.0.0-M7'

fields.description:
Junit 5 has some nice features for unit testing exceptions using Lambdas.

Continuation of https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4740

comments.body: FYI [~andreoss] please leave it in "Resolved", we generally use "Closed" for things like duplicate issues instead
Admittedly, this is not really documented though.
